Increases the rate of piety gained per month when piety is above zero.Reduces the rate of piety gained per month when piety is below zero.
Modifies the rate at which harmonization occurs.
Adds to the rate of harmony gained per year.
Adds to the rate of karma gained per month.
Increases the rate of karma gained per month when karma is above zero.Reduces the rate of karma gained per month when karma is below zero.
Modifies the yearly decay rate of Karma towards 0.
Adds to the yearly reduction rate of doom.
Adds to the rate of Inti authority gained per year.
Modifies the war score cost for the Enforce Religion peace term.
Adds to the prestige bonus gained per development when successfully converting a province to a state religion.
Modifies the war score costs for peace terms while in war against countries of a different religion.
Modifies the cost for using the ‘Establish Order’ action.
Adds to conversion resistance from centres of reformation in all provinces.
Adds to this countries opinion towards other countries with the same religion.
Adds to this countries opinion towards other countries with heretic religions.
Adds to this countries opinion towards other countries with heathen religions.
Adds to the opinion of OTHER countries with the same religion towards this country.
Adds to the opinion of OTHER countries with heretic religions towards this country.
Adds to the opinion of OTHER countries with heathen religions towards this country.
Removes the penalties associated with negative religious tolerance.
Grants an increase in manpower recovery by a factor of 3 during religious wars.
Forbids the country to form colonies
Modifies the base colonist count for a country.
Adds to the base colonial placement chance for colonists, which is the chance that additional settlers will be spawned while the colonist is present.
Adds to the base yearly colonial growth gain.
Modifies the colonial maintenance cost for a country.
Modifies the base colonisation range, used for exploration, colonisation and coring province that border sea.
Adds to the chance of native uprisings in a colony province.
Modifies the bonus from assimilation in colonies. Native assimilation is bonus to goods produced depends on the native population.
Modifies the cost for the migration action for primitive nations that can migrate.
Modifies the tariff income from colonial nations.
Modifies the income from treasure fleets sent by colonial nations.
Modifies the cost of using the ‘Expel Minorities’ action.
Allows the recruitment of explorers and conquisadors.
Grants the abiliy to automatically discover undiscovered provinces adjacent to colonies.
Allows the usage of the Siberian frontier mechanic.
Removes maintenance cost for explorers and conquisadors.
Grants bonus tax, production and manpower on completed colonies.
Modifies the bonus trade power inland nodes receive from trade power sources.
Forbids a nations to send merchants to trade nodes
Adds to the base merchant count for a country.
Adds to the additional trade power when a merchant present in a trade node.
Modifies the additional trade power when a merchant present in a trade node.
Modifies the trade power in all trade nodes for a country.
Modifies the trade power for a country in trade nodes that are notdomestic.
Modifies the trade power for a country in trade nodes that aredomestic.
Modifies the base trade power of owned provinces.
Modifies the base trade good size of owned provinces.
Adds to the trade good size in a country
Modifies a country's trade income. (Maximum is 200%)
Modifies the trade range used to determine if a country can place a merchant in a trade node.
Modifies the bonus to trade power used for steering when determining which outgoing node trade is steered to. If you have a merchant present, it also slightly increases the outgoing value.
Modifies the trade power ships grant when protecting trade.
Modifies the effectiveness of privateers in a trade node.
Modifies the effectiveness of embargoing another country.
Modifies the propagation of trade power from ships protecting trade.
Modifies the cost of upgrading a center of trade in a province.
Modifies the cost of purchasing a trade company investment in a state.
Modifies the cost of the ‘Boost Mercantilism’ action.
Modifies the trade power penalty from collecting in your non-main trade nodes.
Adds to the maximum attrition that can be experienced in a province.
Adds to the base attrition in a province.
Adds to the base attrition for enemies in a province.
Adds to the local attacker dice roll bonus
Adds to the local defender dice roll bonus
Adds to the fort level in a province, determining how difficult it is to siege.
Modifies the rate of garrison growth in a province.
Modifies the defensiveness of a province, impacting siege phase length.
Modifies the local fort maintenance in a province
Modifies the base garrison size in a province
Modifies the damage the local garrison deals when the fort gets assaulted or when a country use the sortie to fight the hostile army.
Modifies the military cost to assault the fort of the province.
Modifies the damage the troops deal to the garrison when assaulting a fort of the province.
Modifies the movement speed of units in a province that are considered friendly.
Modifies the movement speed of units in a province that are considered enemies.
Adds to the base manpower value. 1 equals 1000 men.
Modifies the manpower efficiency in a province.
Modifies the recruitment cost of land units in a province.
Modifies the recruitment speed of land units in a province.
Adds to the base supply limit of a province.
Modifies the supply limit efficiency of a province.
Adds to the dice roll bonus on a provinces' coast
Allows Manchu banner units to be raised in owned provinces.
Modifies the amount of banners that can be raised from a province. When it set in a static modifier it is applied multiplicatively, but in other cases it is additive.
Modifies the amount of Cawa units that can be raised from a province. When it set in a static modifier it is applied multiplicatively, but in other cases it is additive.
Allows Carolean units to be raised in owned provinces.
Modifies the amount of Carolean units that can be raised from a province. When it set in a static modifier it is applied multiplicatively, but in other cases it is additive.
Modifies the amount of Winged Hussar units that can be raised from a province. When it set in a static modifier it is applied multiplicatively, but in other cases it is additive.

Modifies the naval engagement width in a province. Only usable in sea provinces.

Modifies the number of ships required to fully blockade the province.

Prevents coastal raiding in a province.
